intro: Dorstenia zambesiaca, commonly known as the Zambesi false banana, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the fronds of a banana plant. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Dorstenia zambesiaca is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight.
